pullRequest.body:
```
/-- Equivalence between `FDRep` and the full subcategory of finite dimensional `Rep`. -/
def equivFiniteDimensional :
    FDRep k G ≌ FullSubcategory (fun V : Rep k G ↦ FiniteDimensional k V)
```

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

Do you mind also reviewing #14309, it's very easy change
I have done that.
If you remove `toRep` (happy to consider it in a separate PR) I'm happy to merge.

Could you update the PR description? 

bors d+

:v: grhkm21 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Oh sorry, I completely missed the delegated message.
This is ready for review
It seems to me this is unused. Could be safely removed?
I thought it would be helpful in general, since there is `toRep` on objects there should also be a map for morphisms. But I can remove yes
For now, I think we should remove it. (Also, it does not follow mathlib's naming conventions.)
We should not construct data using such tactics. Did you try `unitIso := Iso.refl _`?
I don't like this: as you immediately discover below, there are then too many ways to say the same thing, and naming becomes inconsistent.
I think we usually make such things `equiv` not `equivalence`.
You could probably also leave out Subcategory, naming this just `equivFiniteDimensionsal` (also above).
I guess this still needs cleaning up.
Hmm, I don't plan to deal with the TODO in this PR. For now I use `forget\2 ... V`, since it seems a lot of lemmas are stated so.
Is it okay for me to merge this PR? Maybe the TODO can be handled some other time.

pullRequest.title: feat(RepresentationTheory/FdRep): FdRep is a full subcategory of Rep
